result.execSummary:
The defendant Cathy D. Ferrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence in being

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations and/or medications
Participate an successfully complete any assessment, treatment or counseling as recommended by the risk assessment or as directed by the supervising agent, including AODA
Report any prescription medications to agent within 24 hours
Payment of all court ordered fees, supervision fees and restitution and maintain monthly payments

Sentencing Hearing 06/24/2019

02:20 PM DA calls cases 16CF32, 16CF33, 18CF6, 18CF9, 18CF10 and 18CF13 Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA States Departments receipt and review of PSI. Court questions Atty Kirkpatrick of receipt and review of PSI. Atty Kirkpatrick acknowledges they have. Court gives DA and Atty Kirkpatrick letter from DE's pastor. Court acknowledges PSI and alternative PSI and reviewed also acknowledges letter from pastor. DA states not objections to departments PSI recommendations. Atty Kirkpatrick gives comments on the PSI and states DE has no been on probation. DA gives comments. DA gives Arguments/comments and sentencing recommendations. Arguments/Comments by Atty Kirkpatrick on sentencing recommendations. DE gives comments to the court. Court gives comments and proceeds to sentencing.  Parties argue jail credit from 16CF82 180 days, Court makes no decision on credit from that case.  Court fills on all cases the written explation of determination of sentence and voting rights filled out and copy given to DE in Court.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Maintain Full time employment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Participate an successfully complete any assessment, treatment or counseling as recommended by the risk assessment or as directed by the supervising agent, including AODA
- Psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations and/or medications
- Report any prescription medications to agent within 24 hours
- Payment of all court ordered fees, supervision fees and restitution and maintain monthly payments
- Complete Victim Impact Group

DE not eligible for the Challenge incarceration program
DE is eligible for substance abuse program

Court advises DE of loss of rights as a convicted felon. 

Appeal Rights Given

DE taken into custody today, to Price County Jail today 06/24/2019.

09:15 AM DA calls cases 16CF32, 16CF33, 16CF82, 18CF6, 18CF9, 18CF10, 18CF13, 18CF15 Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement has been reached on all cases and motions to proceed to plea hearing. Court states Atty Kirkpatrick provided plea questionaire and waiver of rights on all cases. DA states facts on cases with additional elements stated. Court questions DE.  DA states arrainment has occurred on all cases. DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance.  Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Atty Kirkpatrick addresses court on status of DE health issues. Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on the following cases and counts. Pre Sentence Investigation is ordered by the court and completed within 6 weeks. Sentencing to be scheuled by beginning of April with JA. Bond to continue in all cases.

03:06 PM DA calls case 16CF33 and states appearances. Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states supplemental Limine was filed. DA addresses court on motion,  Atty Kirkpatrick addresses court regarding motion and limine filed and number purposed is 4. 08:35 AM - DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Outside the presence of jurors. Discussion regarding number of jurors. Argument regarding motion filed by Atty Kirkpatrick re: entrapment. Discussion. Recess at 8:55 am. Back on record at 9:47 am and outside the presence of jurors. Court summarizes discussion off record. DA asks for ruling on "other crimes". Court adjourns trial. Court does not make a ruling on that matter. DA asks for clarification. Comments by parties regarding continuing to trial. Adj 10:01 am. Jury will be advised off the record.

2:11 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kirkpatrick comments re: audio recording, most of which is garbled. DA comments on recording. Further argument by Atty Kirkpatrick. Parties come to an agreement re: recording. Atty Kirkpatrick argues image capture re: text messages. DA argues. Comments by Court. Further discussion. Court denies motion to suppress. Court addresses motions in limine. Off record at 2:51 pm. Back on record at 2:55 pm. Court summarizes what was discussed off record. Atty Kirkpatrick may have another jury trial next week which may go 3 days next week. Atty Kirkpatrick to let the Court know ASAP. Court discusses proposed jury instructions submitted by DE, and about an alternate juror. Adj 3:01 pm

1:54 pm - DA calls cases 16CF32, 16CF33, 16CF82, 18CF6, 18CF9, 18CF10, 18CF13, 18CF15 and states appearances. Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is a motion to modify bond due to DE's health. DA has no objection to Motion. Statement by Atty Kirkpatrick.  Response by DA. DE comments regarding health conditions. Court orders a $2000 Cash bond along with a $20,000 Signature bond both with the added condition that the DE may not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court. One bond for all cases. DA questions Court about jury trial set in16CF33 October 3, moving it to #1 trial. So ordered. Adj 2:11 pm

10:45 am - DA calls case and states apppearances.  Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kirkpatrick asked for this hearing.  Court addresses DE re: pre-trial matters.  Atty Kirkpatrick moves to adjourn trial 7/20/18 as he has filed motions to suppress and to give State time to respond.  State does not object to adjournment.  Court orders jury trial removed from calendar on 7/20/18.  Motion hearing and jury trial to be scheduled. Court orders that any written submissions from Attys be received 7 days in advance of motion hearing. Parties to inform Court of motions that are agreed upon and those that are not.  Adj 10:55 am.

12:00 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  DE does not appear.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared telephonically.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states facts of case.  Court acknowledges that Atty Kirkpatrick was in an auto accident and DE had made a speedy trial request.  Atty Kirkpatrick makes statement re: accident and scheduling issues and meeting with DE at Taylor County jail.  Atty Kirkpatrick states that DE is willing to waive speedy trial demand. Comments by Court.  Atty Kirkpatrick will continue to represent the DE.  Atty Kirkpatrick to file written confirmation of discussion with DE.  Court orders Jury trial removed for 5/21/18. 2:15 pm - DA calls cases 18CF6, 18CF9, 18CF10, 18CF13, 18CF15(Prel) and 16CF32, 16CF33, 16CF82 (STC) and states appearances.  Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ON the 18CF cases Atty Kirkpatrick presents court with a waiver of preliminary exam.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court.  Court finds probable cause exists and binds DE over for trial.  Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.
Atty Kirkpatrick comments on the 16CF cases and DE asks for a speedy trial demand in case 16CF33.  To be set for trial.  The other 16 cases are to track along with 16CF33.  DA states that he would have a problem submitting a learned treatise 40 days before trial.  Scheduling to be worked out to allow state time for that.
